title.text: Intelligent Linux Information Access by Data Mining: the ILIAD Project

entities.text: Intelligent Linux Information Access by Data Mining

abstractContent.text: We propose an alternative to conventional information retrieval over Linux forum data, based on thread-, post-and user-level analysis, interfaced with an information retrieval engine via reranking.

introductionContent.text: Due to the sheer scale of web data, simple keyword matching is an effective means of information access for many informational web queries.
There still remain significant clusters of information access needs, however, where keyword matching is less successful.

One such instance is technical web forums and mailing lists (collectively termed "forums" for the purposes of this paper): technical forums area rich source of information when troubleshooting, and it is often possible to resolve technical queries/problems via web-archived data.

This paper provides a brief outline of an attempt to achieve these and other goals in the context of Linux web user forum data, in the form of the IL-IAD (Intelligent Linux Information Access by Data Mining) project.

introductionContent.text: Linux users and developers rely particularly heavily on web user forums and mailing lists, due to the nature of the community, which is highly decentralised -with massive proliferation of packages and distributions -and notoriously bad at maintaining up-to-date documentation at a level suitable for newbie and even intermediate users.
